name: Media Governance and Industries Research Lab of the University of Vienna
goal:
The Media Governance and Industries Research Lab, established by Professor Sarikakis in 2011, brings together international scholars from different cognate disciplines, whose intellectual and sociocultural interests gravitate to the systematic study of the policies and politics of media, culture and communication. Our teaching is research-informed and our paedagogical philosophy is based on active, student-centred and student-led learning. We are welcoming new PhD students and scholars interested in working on the topics of the research described on the Lab's website.


Research Directions

Social Media and Information Platforms and Technologisation of Citizens-Users' Rights'
Digital Policies and Social Change
Global Integration, and the Process and Politics of Media and Cultural Governance
interests: Communication, Competition, Culture, Culture and media, Digital economy and society, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Research and innovation
euInitiatives:
AVMS REFIT Review
Regulatory environment for platforms, online intermediaries, data and cloud computing and the collaborative economy
Copyright Reform
Telecommunication Review
Spectrum policy
